org.fosstrak.reader.rprm.core.msg
Class OutgoingMessageDispatcher

java.lang.Object
  org.fosstrak.reader.rprm.core.msg.OutgoingMessageDispatcher

public class OutgoingMessageDispatcher
extends java.lang.Object

OutgoingMessageDispatcher sends a message to a given client (called "host" in the EPC Reader Protocol). MessageDispatcher or NotificationListener call the sendMessage() method of the OutgoingMessageDispatcher to send a message. It receives a clientID to which the message has to be sent. Using Clients it finds an OutgoingMessageBuffer that belongs to the client with given client id and puts the message into the buffer.

Author:
Dijana Micijevic, ETH Zurich Switzerland, Winter 2003/04, Andreas Fürer, ETH Zurich Switzerland, Winter 2005/06

public void sendMessage(java.util.List clients,

Puts a message into a corresponding buffer. It gets a corresponding buffer from Clients since it gets a ClientID as a parameter (i.e. a list of client ids) Method sendMessage

Parameters:
clients - a list of client ids to whome the message has to be sent

sendMessage

public void sendMessage(java.lang.String clientID,
                        java.lang.String msg)
Puts a message into a corresponding buffer. It gets a corresponding buffer from Clients since it gets a ClientID as a parameter.

Parameters:
clientID - the client id to whom the message has to be sent.
msg - the message to send

sendRequest

public void sendRequest(java.lang.String clientID,
                        java.lang.String msg)
Puts a request message into a corresponding buffer like the method sendMessage above but filters out the http messages for special handling (see ReadReportNotificationListener method notifyHost).

Parameters:
clientID - the client id to whom the message has to be sent.
msg - the message to send.
